026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html;
027
028import java.util.SortedSet;
029
030import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
031import javax.lang.model.element.ModuleElement;
032import javax.lang.model.element.PackageElement;
033
034import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.Navigation.PageMode;
035import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.ContentBuilder;
036import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlId;
037import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlStyle;
038import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlTree;
039import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.Script;
040import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.Text;
041import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Content;
042import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocFileIOException;
043import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocPath;
044import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.SummaryAPIListBuilder;
045import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.SummaryAPIListBuilder.SummaryElementKind;
046
047/**
048 * Base class for generating a summary page that lists elements with a common characteristic,
049 * such as deprecated elements, preview elements, and so on.
050 */
051public abstract class SummaryListWriter<B extends SummaryAPIListBuilder>
052        extends SubWriterHolderWriter {
053
054    protected String getHeadingKey(SummaryElementKind kind) {
055        return switch (kind) {
056        case MODULE -> "doclet.Modules";
057        case PACKAGE -> "doclet.Packages";
058        case INTERFACE -> "doclet.Interfaces";
059        case CLASS -> "doclet.Classes";
060        case ENUM -> "doclet.Enums";
061        case EXCEPTION_CLASS -> "doclet.ExceptionClasses";
062        case ANNOTATION_TYPE -> "doclet.Annotation_Types";
063        case FIELD -> "doclet.Fields";
064        case METHOD -> "doclet.Methods";
065        case CONSTRUCTOR -> "doclet.Constructors";
066        case ENUM_CONSTANT -> "doclet.Enum_Constants";
067        case ANNOTATION_TYPE_MEMBER -> "doclet.Annotation_Type_Members";
068        case RECORD_CLASS -> "doclet.RecordClasses";
069        };
070    }
071
072    private String getHeaderKey(SummaryElementKind kind) {
073        return switch (kind) {
074        case MODULE -> "doclet.Module";
075        case PACKAGE -> "doclet.Package";
076        case INTERFACE -> "doclet.Interface";
077        case CLASS -> "doclet.Class";
078        case ENUM -> "doclet.Enum";
079        case EXCEPTION_CLASS -> "doclet.ExceptionClass";
080        case ANNOTATION_TYPE -> "doclet.AnnotationType";
081        case FIELD -> "doclet.Field";
082        case METHOD -> "doclet.Method";
083        case CONSTRUCTOR -> "doclet.Constructor";
084        case ENUM_CONSTANT -> "doclet.Enum_Constant";
085        case ANNOTATION_TYPE_MEMBER -> "doclet.Annotation_Type_Member";
086        case RECORD_CLASS -> "doclet.RecordClass";
087        };
088    }
089
090    /** The summary list builder */
091    protected final B builder;
092
093    /**
094     * Constructor.
095     *
096     * @param configuration the configuration for this doclet
097     * @param filename the file to be generated
098     * @param builder the summary list builder
099     */
100    public SummaryListWriter(HtmlConfiguration configuration, DocPath filename,
101            B builder) {
102        super(configuration, filename);
103        this.builder = builder;
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Generate the API summary.
108     *
109     * @param pageMode page mode to use
110     * @param description page description
111     * @param headContent page heading content
112     * @param titleKey page title resource key
113     * @throws DocFileIOException if there is a problem writing the summary list
114     */
115    protected void generateSummaryListFile(PageMode pageMode,
116            String description,
117            Content headContent, String titleKey)
118            throws DocFileIOException {
119        HtmlTree body = getHeader(pageMode, titleKey);
120        Content content = new ContentBuilder();
121        var heading = HtmlTree.HEADING_TITLE(Headings.PAGE_TITLE_HEADING,
122            HtmlStyle.title, headContent);
123        content.add(HtmlTree.DIV(HtmlStyle.header, heading));
124        addContentSelectors(content);
125        content.add(HtmlTree.HEADING_TITLE(Headings.CONTENT_HEADING,
126            contents.contentsHeading));
127        content.add(getContentsList());
128        addExtraSection(content);
129        for (SummaryElementKind kind : SummaryElementKind.values()) {
130            if (builder.hasDocumentation(kind)) {
131                addSummaryAPI(builder.getSet(kind),
132                    HtmlIds.forSummaryKind(kind),
133                    getHeadingKey(kind), getHeaderKey(kind), content);
134            }
135        }
136        bodyContents.addMainContent(content);
137        // The script below enables checkboxes in the page and invokes their
138        // click handler
139        // to restore any previous state when the page is loaded via
140        // back/forward button.
141        bodyContents.addMainContent(new Script("""
142                document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function(e) {
143                    document.querySelectorAll('input[type="checkbox"]').forEach(
144                        function(c) {
145                            c.disabled = false;
146                            c.onclick();
147                        });
148                    });
149                window.addEventListener("load", function(e) {
150                    document.querySelectorAll('input[type="checkbox"]').forEach(
151                        function(c) {
152                            c.onclick();
153                        });
154                    });
155                """).asContent());
156        bodyContents.setFooter(getFooter());
157        body.add(bodyContents);
158        printHtmlDocument(null, description, body);
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * Add the index link.
163     *
164     * @param id the id for the link
165     * @param headingKey the key for the heading content
166     * @param content the content to which the index link will be added
167     */
168    protected void addIndexLink(HtmlId id, String headingKey, Content content) {
169        // The "contents-" + id value is used in JavaScript code to toggle
170        // visibility of the link.
171        var li = HtmlTree.LI(links.createLink(id,
172            contents.getContent(headingKey)))
173            .setId(HtmlId.of("contents-" + id.name()));
174        content.add(li);
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Get the contents list.
179     *
180     * @return the contents list
181     */
182    public Content getContentsList() {
183        var ul = HtmlTree.UL(HtmlStyle.contentsList);
184        addExtraIndexLink(ul);
185        for (SummaryElementKind kind : SummaryElementKind.values()) {
186            if (builder.hasDocumentation(kind)) {
187                addIndexLink(HtmlIds.forSummaryKind(kind), getHeadingKey(kind),
188                    ul);
189            }
190        }
191        return ul;
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * @param pageMode page mode to use
196     * @param titleKey page title resource key
197     * {@return the header for the API Summary listing}
198     */
199    public HtmlTree getHeader(PageMode pageMode, String titleKey) {
200        String title = resources.getText(titleKey);
201        HtmlTree body = getBody(getWindowTitle(title));
202        bodyContents.setHeader(getHeader(pageMode));
203        return body;
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * Add summary information to the documentation
208     *
209     * @param apiList list of API summary elements
210     * @param id the id attribute of the table
211     * @param headingKey the caption for the summary table
212     * @param headerKey table header key for the summary table
213     * @param content the content to which the summary table will be added
214     */
215    protected void addSummaryAPI(SortedSet<Element> apiList, HtmlId id,
216            String headingKey, String headerKey,
217            Content content) {
218        if (apiList.size() > 0) {
219            TableHeader tableHeader = getTableHeader(headerKey);
220
221            var table = new Table<Element>(HtmlStyle.summaryTable)
222                .setCaption(getTableCaption(headingKey))
223                .setHeader(tableHeader)
224                .setId(id)
225                .setColumnStyles(getColumnStyles());
226            addTableTabs(table, headingKey);
227            for (Element e : apiList) {
228                Content link;
229                switch (e.getKind()) {
230                case MODULE -> {
231                    ModuleElement m = (ModuleElement) e;
232                    link = getModuleLink(m, Text.of(m.getQualifiedName()));
233                }
234                case PACKAGE -> {
235                    PackageElement pkg = (PackageElement) e;
236                    link = getPackageLink(pkg, getLocalizedPackageName(pkg));
237                }
238                default -> link = getSummaryLink(e);
239                }
240                Content extraContent = getExtraContent(e);
241                Content desc = new ContentBuilder();
242                addComments(e, desc);
243                if (extraContent != null) {
244                    table.addRow(e, link, extraContent, desc);
245                } else {
246                    table.addRow(e, link, desc);
247                }
248            }
249            // note: singleton list
250            content.add(HtmlTree.UL(HtmlStyle.blockList, HtmlTree.LI(table)));
251        }
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Add summary text for the given element.
256     *
257     * @param e the element for which the summary text should be added
258     * @param desc the content to which the text should be added
259     */
260    protected void addComments(Element e, Content desc) {
261    }
262
263    protected Content getSummaryLink(Element e) {
264        AbstractMemberWriter writer = switch (e.getKind()) {
265        case INTERFACE, CLASS, ENUM, ANNOTATION_TYPE, RECORD -> new NestedClassWriterImpl(
266            this);
267        case FIELD -> new FieldWriterImpl(this);
268        case METHOD -> new MethodWriterImpl(this);
269        case CONSTRUCTOR -> new ConstructorWriterImpl(this);
270        case ENUM_CONSTANT -> new EnumConstantWriterImpl(this);
271        case RECORD_COMPONENT -> throw new AssertionError(
272            "Record components are not supported by SummaryListWriter!");
273        default -> throw new UnsupportedOperationException(
274            "Unsupported element kind: " + e.getKind());
275        };
276        return writer.getSummaryLink(e);
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * Add an extra optional section to the content.
281     *
282     * @param target the content to which the section should be added
283     */
284    protected void addExtraSection(Content target) {
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Add an extra optional index link.
289     *
290     * @param target the content to which the link should be added
291     */
292    protected void addExtraIndexLink(Content target) {
293    }
294
295    /**
296     * Subclasses allow the user to show or hide parts of the content in the page.
297     * This method should be used to add the UI to select the visible page content.
298     *
299     * @param target the content to which the UI should be added
300     */
301    protected abstract void addContentSelectors(Content target);
302
303    /**
304     * Some subclasses of this class display an extra column in their element tables.
305     * This methods allows them to return the content to show for {@code element}.
306     *
307     * @param element the element
308     * @return content for extra content or null
309     */
310    protected abstract Content getExtraContent(Element element);
311
312    /**
313     * Gets the table header to use for a table with the first column identified by {@code headerKey}.
314     *
315     * @param headerKey the header key for the first table column
316     * @return the table header
317     */
318    protected TableHeader getTableHeader(String headerKey) {
319        return new TableHeader(
320            contents.getContent(headerKey), contents.descriptionLabel);
321    }
322
323    /**
324     * Gets the array of styles to use for table columns. The length of the returned
325     * array must match the number of column headers returned by {@link #getTableHeader(String)}.
326     *
327     * @return the styles to use for table columns
328     */
329    protected HtmlStyle[] getColumnStyles() {
330        return new HtmlStyle[] { HtmlStyle.colSummaryItemName,
331            HtmlStyle.colLast };
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Returns the caption for the table with the given {@code headingKey}.
336     *
337     * @param headingKey the key for the table heading
338     * @return the table caption
339     */
340    protected Content getTableCaption(String headingKey) {
341        return contents.getContent(headingKey);
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Allow subclasses to add extra tabs to the element tables.
346     *
347     * @param table the element table
348     * @param headingKey the key for the caption (default tab)
349     */
350    protected abstract void addTableTabs(Table<Element> table,
351            String headingKey);
352}
